edu.umass.cs.MHLClient.sensors

Class SensorReading

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.MHLClient.sensors.SensorReading
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccelerometerReading, GPSReading, GyroscopeReading, RSSIReading

    public abstract class SensorReading
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for a sensor reading. You may use existing implementations such as AccelerometerReading or, if your sensing modality is not available, subclass SensorReading in your own custom reading. To do so, you must only define the toJSONObject() method.
    See Also:
    JSONObject, AccelerometerReading, GyroscopeReading, RSSIReading

    • Constructor Detail

      • SensorReading

        protected SensorReading(java.lang.String userID,
                        java.lang.String deviceType,
                        java.lang.String deviceID,
                        java.lang.String sensorType,
                        long timestamp)
        Instantiates a sensor reading object. Because SensorReading is abstract, this should only be called by subclasses for initializing metadata common across sensing modalities.
        Parameters:
        userID - a 10-byte hex string identifying the current user.
        deviceType - describes the device.
        deviceID - TODO
        sensorType - identifies the sensor type.
        timestamp - indicates when the sensor reading occurred, in Unix time by convention.

    • Method Detail

      • getUserID

        public java.lang.String getUserID()
        Gets the user identifier.
        Returns:
        a 10-byte hex string identifying the current user.

        Gets the device type associated with the sensor reading.
        Returns:
        a String representing the device type.

      • getSensorType

        public java.lang.String getSensorType()
        Gets the sensor modality associated with the sensor reading.
        Returns:
        a String representing the sensor type.

      • getTimestamp

        public long getTimestamp()
        Gets the timestamp at which the sensor reading occurred.
        Returns:
        a timestamp, in Unix time by convention.

      • toJSONObject

        protected abstract JSONObject toJSONObject()
        Defines how the data is converted to a JSON object.
        Returns:
        a JSON object encoding the sensor reading.

      • getBaseJSONObject

        protected JSONObject getBaseJSONObject()
        Returns a base JSON object with the sensor reading metadata already encoded. The 'data' object is left undefined and should be specified by subclasses that use this method.
        Returns:
        a JSON object encoding the metadata.

      • toJSONString

        public java.lang.String toJSONString()
        Converts the JSON object into a transmission-ready string.
        Returns:
        a string form of the JSON object.
